titleStmt.title: Reference list of locations in Ottoman Syria

publicationStmt.p: The file was originally created in November 2012 and is continuously updated through manual and automated input by the original author.

projectDesc.p: The TEI file was produced by Till Grallert to provide a list of geo-tagged toponyms extracted from a database of sources (Sente XML) and enriched with geo information from geonames.org

editorialDecl.p: The relation between places, toponyms and their geographic location was recorded using TEI P5 XML. Individual place nodes are nested inside listPlace nodes following administrative and topographic structures. Thus the quarters of the city of Damascus are recorded as place nodes nested inside a listPlace that corresponds to the city. The city of Damascus is then part of a listPlace for the county, the district, and the province. Future improvements could record different sets of relations in parallel listPlace nodes that all link to a flat tree of places.
The transscription of Arabic and Ottoman toponyms follows the IJMES paradigm.

Languages: According to TEI P5 xml:lang should follow BCP 47
, which specifies for Arabic in Latin transcription "ar-Latn". The specific type of transcription should be added as a private use subtag, i.e. "ar-Latn-x-ijmes" for the IJMES transcription of Arabic in Latin script. The tag for Ottoman Turkish is "ota". For transcription in Latin script following an adapted IJMES transcription, it would be "ota-Latn-x-ijmes". The English variant of Latinised Arabic would be "ar-Latn-EN" and the French "ar-Latn-FR"
the structur of the element geo is lat, long

The pattern of xml:id s is the following:
- no xml:id : no reference to this place could be found in online databases
- xml:id starting with lgn [location geonames] refer to geoname.org/xml:id
- xml:id starting with lwm [location wikimapia] refer to wikimapia.org/xml:id
- in case of Ottoman provinces named after their capital cities, a "p" is amended to the end of the xml:id.

revisionDesc.tei:change: Improved person nodes that had references to VIAF, by querying VIAF and adding birth , death , and idno .

revisionDesc.change: Automatically fixed mark-up by adding idno pointing to Geonames or Wikimapia to place nodes and source to placeName type="alt" pointing to the source for this information.
created a hierarchy of quarters and neighbourhoods in Damascus
expanded the project description and editorial declarations
